documents.document: Finally catching up with @NSSDeviations, I missed it but now l'm listening to the last pre-election episode, weird how things changed 😐
@gedankenstuecke let's hope more formal political movements will work on that
That's useful... (there are 1167360 tiles if you are wondering...) #Rstats #fail https://t.co/mtcYolE3EB
@emmetbroaders @sarahjeong the good news is that it means that we are still alive
@Rubberbandits and with good actors
@wilw @GreatDismal the GMO revolution
@sarahjeong yes that's funny to see how they react when liberals (mainly not people who think like them) are not "politically correct"
@tgjelten @GreatDismal wow, that's amazing
@kwbroman @SenRonJohnson are these people real or is it yet another US joke for the rest of the world ?
@Marxofthejungle @grincheuse1 @fustinette @NassiraELM trop cool, bonne chance
@jaketapper they are neo nazis, so...
It's like these 15yo kids who suggests simple ideas to fix/cure the world, make scientists look like idiots, but ig… https://t.co/AfMzg2yTEZ
I'm watching The West Wing, the contrast between Jed Bartlet and Donald Trump is astonishing, and also very depressing
@jonathan_mccrea I agree ppl need to be careful, but don't need to let the fascists censor them. They will always find a way to spin things
@Alex_Parker we need a building across the US-Canada border
@fk_eduardo it terrifies me, both his or her victory are going to be devastating
@fk_eduardo just comparing the ideas, of course she won, it was easier for the left to vote for her than it is for Fillon
@fk_eduardo the same who predicted Clinton would win? Let's wait for the results of today election for the PS
@fk_eduardo sadly he has no chance I think
He also praises Putin and is against abortion for example (youpi happy France! 🎉🙃)
And the alternative François Fillon is not good, not a Clinton-Trump situation, more like a Ryan-Trump situation
She praises Trump and Putin, wants France out of the EU, wants to close the borders, pro-bigots, racist, ties w/ neo-nazis etc...
Le Pen is sure to make it to the second round of the election, I hope we will vote her out, but if she is elected, it will be horrific
(..) in France, same story, they gave a lot of power to the police. Today it's a moderate socio-lib gov, in 3 months maybe a far right one
(...) Even if these laws / decrees come from a liberal and moderate government. Obama opened some doors, Trump use them (...)
These new attacks on human rights by @realDonaldTrump reminds us to fight against law giving too much power to the administrations (...)
@JoshuaChavers @brianstelter @jaketapper I guess I will never visit the US then...
@dataandme no, I do sometimes to create small apps but it's really painful
@brianstelter what is he drinking? Is he really drinking coke in the oval office?
We seriously need a strong Europe to have a chance against Trump's USA and Putin's Russia right now!
@nathanheller @sciencegurlz0 it's more likely that our next president will send you a second one, we also have a big far right problem
@tadekwwa empeach one after the other maybe? A coup? Protests to force them to resign?
@tadekwwa there are ways to get rid of both, and of all the government.
@jaketapper what was the global number of refugees?
I really hope Americans are not waiting for the next election to remove Trump from office
"All computer programs and datasets discussed in this article are available upon request for academic use" Oh great...
I didn't really have plan to go to a US conference or work there later, I think this idea completely dead now...
He lost!!! https://t.co/JgCEJTf9fK
@aaronquinlan that would be perfect for my phd :)
@genetics_blog I wondered if something like that existed, I wanted to do the same thing for peptidomics
@JordanUhl @GreatDismal it seems so easy that it wouldn't be surprising that multiple countries are already tapping his phone
@jaketapper I don't understand how people can become this rich being this stupid...
Awesome, my favourite LaTeX beamer theme is available via RMarkdown! https://t.co/pBoDcxPvlM
@liber8dRage that's a good name :)
@Acosta so thay have no idea what they are doing
@joshtpm and it feels good for us
I don't have any degree in economics but I'm pretty sure that it's not how it works... https://t.co/kxcvasa0Os
When I realise that rabbits are completely messing with my analysis https://t.co/uzLhwKRKHJ
@joshtpm the whole British politics is ridiculous right now, not surprising
@TaraFlynn exactly, and sadly it's easy because we have history books, it's not like it never happened before...
@aishagani @GreatDismal the sad irony of living in a age when it just takes seconds to check facts...
To people discovering that Trump is doing what he said e would do and didn't change: WTF?! https://t.co/UkACeKVzOh
@TriploidTree I hope that the American people will solve this problem before it's too late for everyone
Does it means that every scientific article needs to be reviewed by a political censor before submission? https://t.co/oUgL9yMP0A
@TriploidTree maybe we should directly ask @BillGates or @elonmusk ... Anyway, I think it's already too late
@TriploidTree yes, that's the main problem
@TriploidTree why not :) we need to ask political asylum for these data in another country now
@TriploidTree something like that https://t.co/0ymANDpaP6 but either way it wouldn't be very discrete :D
@TriploidTree even that, that's a enormous (especially raw data), and it also needs to reinstall the servers (hardware and software), etc...
Seriously I'm afraid of what can happen, to the US people and the rest of the world, at every level, research or not
@TriploidTree I don't know, it's really huge, it's maybe possible for specific datasets but the whole thing, it's enormous
Maybe it's time for the French parliament to vote anti-nepotism and corruption laws for politicians, oh wait, why would they do that?... 🤔
Even without that, the repercussions of a diminished and censored US research is a huge concern to all researchers and the world
Is it plausible to imagine Trump asking for money to access US databases from the rest of the world?
I don't think our governments pay the USA to maintain the NCBI infrastructure (even though we generate/curate data)
I can't start to list how much we (non US) we rely on US resources
Maybe we should start copying all the NCBI data outside of the USA 🤔
Yet another attempt to summarise huge scientific fields in 3 minutes...
@BioMickWatson now you may want to leave the UK...
@gedankenstuecke wow, this is going to end well, to be fair they are better off without people thinking like that...
@_KimCon if only they watched The West Wing...
I'm not sure adding the labels was a good idea... #dataviz #fail https://t.co/dCBohldnSo
@SwiftOnSecurity oh, so that's not why we are on the alt- reality now?
A while ago I joked about all the alien invasions in movies set in the US, it's not funny anymore, imagine how Trump will react...
Apparently I have a new hobby: forgetting to push commits...
I wonder how many persons are going to die because of all these stupid decisions made during these few days... https://t.co/Tct5WkLkKt
How many predicted protein sequences don't exist? Or not as they are annotated?

but no human decency https://t.co/vAocQCghUf
